Volatile Magic Shawl

$6.00 • Buy Volatile Magic Shawl now! Pattern Purchase FAQ View on Ravelry

I am a voracious reader. When I think of heroines, I think of my favorite books. This shawl is named for the world Illona Andrews brings to life in her Kate Daniels books: ever changing, unexpected, bold, non-traditional, and sassy as hell. If you were the kind of gal who rooted for Buffy, youâ€™ll love Kate.

The shawl features cascading waves of cables throughout the center, bordered by asymmetrical garter stitch ridges on each side. The generous garter stitch border prevents unnecessary curling after blocking, and the sheen of the silk/wool blend from Wooly Wonka Fibers lends a little something special. Blocking less vigorously than the sample shown will result in more texture in the center section, emphasizing the cables rather than the garter ridges.

The sample shown required approximately 425 yards, using almost the entire skein. If you’re concerned about running out of yarn, you can cut out one of the final cable repeats.

I would recommend cabling without a cable needle for expediency due to the all-over nature of the center motif.

Originally designed exclusively for the Wooly Wonka Fibers Heroine’s Accessory club (July 2013), Volatile Magic Shawl is now available.

Pattern Information

Gauge

26 stitches and 40 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch

Yardage

425 - 435 yards Fingering / 4 ply (14 wpi)

Yarns

Wooly Wonka Fibers Artio Sock (Fingering)

Needles

US 4 - 3.5 mm

Sizes

8.5"/21.5cm at deepest point, 50"/127cm wingspan

About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
